pr_title: Show cluster upgrade plan in the cluster upgrade UI

timeline.bodyText:
I didn't expose this method on purpose.
If you want to get the cluster upgrade plan, you should call upgrade_cluster(plan=True, *args, **kwargs)
Is there a reason why we do want to do it this way?
timeline.author: meaksh

replies.bodyText: I reverted it. It was just matter of personal preference to make the upgrade plan functionality more explicit.
replies.author: mateiw

timeline.bodyText: Same consideration as in above comment
timeline.author: meaksh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -262,7 +262,7 @@ def upgrade_cluster(skuba_cluster_path,
                     **kwargs):
 
     if plan:
-        return _upgrade_cluster_plan(skuba_cluster_path=skuba_cluster_path,
+        return upgrade_cluster_plan(skuba_cluster_path=skuba_cluster_path,

timeline.bodyText: This shouldn't be required in case we simply use upgrade_cluster(plan=True, **)
timeline.author: meaksh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -49,6 +49,9 @@ def upgrade_cluster(provider_module, params):
     fun = _get_provider_fun(provider_module, 'upgrade_cluster')
     return fun(**params)
 
+def upgrade_cluster_plan(provider_module, params):
+    fun = _get_provider_fun(provider_module, 'upgrade_cluster_plan')
+    return fun(**params)
